cyclone.name: IDA
cyclone.current_location: about 75 miles south of the Mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: continuing northwest across the north-central Gulf, then inland over southeast Louisiana before turning north and northeast toward the Mississippi and Tennessee valleys

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch east of the Mouth of the Pearl River to the Alabama/Florida border (none in Texas)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Intracoastal City, LA to the Mouth of the Pearl River; Tropical-Storm Warning Cameron, LA to west of Intracoastal City, LA and Mouth of Pearl River to AL/FL border
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from southeast Texas eastward through Louisiana, Mississippi and Alabama
weather_observation.wind: Only fringe tropical-storm-force gusts possible (10% chance); sustained winds most likely below gale force.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1-2 ft possible along the upper Texas coast due to long-period swells and onshore flow.
weather_observation.rainfall: Light to moderate rain bands, generally well under 2 inches expected.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and rough surf along area beaches.
